semantic_title: Using Signs and Symptoms Codes When Definitive Diagnosis Not Established
section_path: Section I > B. General Coding Guidelines > 4. Signs and symptoms

content.full_text: Codes that describe symptoms and signs, as opposed to diagnoses, are acceptable for reporting purposes when a related definitive diagnosis has not been established (confirmed) by the provider. Chapter 18 of ICD-10-CM, Symptoms, Signs, and Abnormal Clinical and Laboratory Findings, Not Elsewhere Classified (codes R00.0 - R99) contains many, but not all, codes for symptoms. See Section I.B.18. Use of Signs/Symptom/Unspecified Codes (Evidence: pg no: 13, L38-L42)
content.summary: Allows the use of symptom and sign codes when a definitive diagnosis has not been established by the provider, primarily using Chapter 18 codes R00.0-R99. (Evidence: pg no: 13, L38-L42)
key_concepts: Symptom codes acceptable when no definitive diagnosis established (Evidence: pg no: 13, L38-L40)
Chapter 18 contains most but not all symptom codes (Evidence: pg no: 13, L40-L41)
Provider must not have confirmed a definitive diagnosis (Evidence: pg no: 13, L39-L40)
R00.0-R99 code range for symptoms and signs (Evidence: pg no: 13, L40-L41)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Use symptom codes when definitive diagnosis not established by provider (Evidence: pg no: 13, L38-L40)
detailed_rules.explanation: When a healthcare provider has not confirmed or established a definitive diagnosis, it is appropriate and acceptable to report codes that describe the presenting symptoms and signs rather than attempting to assign a definitive diagnostic code (Evidence: pg no: 13, L38-L40)
common_applications: Emergency department visits with unclear diagnosis

detailed_rules.rule_text: Chapter 18 (R00.0-R99) contains many but not all symptom codes (Evidence: pg no: 13, L40-L41)
detailed_rules.explanation: While Chapter 18 is the primary location for symptom and sign codes, symptom codes may also be found in other chapters of ICD-10-CM, so coders should not limit themselves exclusively to the R codes (Evidence: pg no: 13, L40-L41)
common_applications: Searching for symptom codes in disease-specific chapters
Using symptom codes outside Chapter 18 when appropriate

workflow_steps: Step 1: Determine if provider has established a definitive diagnosis
Step 2: If no definitive diagnosis, identify presenting symptoms/signs
Step 3: Look primarily in Chapter 18 (R00.0-R99) for appropriate codes
Step 4: Consider symptom codes in other chapters if needed
Step 5: Assign the most specific symptom code available
